headline: Wendy's closes US restaurants and focuses on value to turn around falling sales
summary: Wendy’s is closing several hundred U.S. restaurants and increasing its focus on value after a weaker-than-expected fourth quarter.  U.S. same-store sales fell even further in the fourth quarter.  Wendy’s said late last year that it planned to close underperforming U.S. restaurants, but it gave more details about those closures Friday.

headline: Restaurants Confront a High Beef-Price Headache
summary: High ground-beef prices have hurt restaurants, particularly burger chains that rely on meat for the bulk of their menus.  “We’ve have unprecedented high levels of beef inflation,” Shake Shack Chief Executive Rob Lynch said in an interview.  The fast-casual burger chain is working with its suppliers to help mitigate some of those costs, but still expects elevated beef prices to pinch this year.

raw.headline: Restaurants Confront a High Beef-Price Headache

headline: Top food executives see the rise of value-seeking consumers
summary: Consumer prices rose less than expected in January, according to last month's Consumer Price Index (CPI) report, signaling a potential slowing in broader inflation trends. Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman takes a look back at what CEOs and other top executives from PepsiCo (PEP), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), Brinker International (EAT), and McDonald's (MCD) have to say about the state of the US consumer. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: After Q4 Earnings Beat, Is Wendy’s (WEN) a Value Opportunity or a Value Trap?
summary: Wendy’s (NASDAQ: WEN) delivered a mixed fourth quarter as the fast-food chain navigates mounting cost pressures and accelerating traffic declines. The company reported revenue of $543.0 million, narrowly topping the $541.3 million consensus estimate, while adjusted earnings per share of $0.16 beat expectations of $0.15. But beneath the headline beat lies a troubling reality: U.S. ... After Q4 Earnings Beat, Is Wendy’s (WEN) a Value Opportunity or a Value Trap?

headline: AI: The Great Disruptor or the Great Divider?
summary: Wall Street faced a bruising session as the S&P 500 wiped out its gains for the year. While artificial intelligence remains the primary engine of growth for some, it has become a source of margin pressure and competitive fear for others, leading to a sharp rotation toward value stocks.

headline: How McDonald's Strong 2025 Earnings and Digital Push Could Shape McDonald's (MCD) Investors
summary: In the fourth quarter and full year 2025, McDonald's reported higher revenue and net income versus 2024, with US$7,009 million in quarterly revenue, US$2,164 million in quarterly net income, and diluted EPS from continuing operations rising to US$3.03 for the quarter and US$11.95 for the year. Alongside these results, McDonald's reinforced its long-term plans by electing Ford CEO Jim Farley to its Board, affirming a US$1.86 quarterly dividend, and leaning into value-led promotions and viral...

headline: Asia shares lower after sharp Wall Street losses on AI-related worries
summary: Asia shares were trading lower Friday, tracking sharp Wall Street losses on a sell-off of technology-related stocks that investors fear could lose out from artificial intelligence disruptions.  “Our sense remains that a sustained reversal of tech outperformance would require a big slide in tech itself,” Thomas Mathews, head of markets for Asia Pacific at Capital Economics wrote in a recent note.
